page.title: 17CRAFT CENTRE - WORSTON MILL
page.content: The Centre, which has been open for three years, is the retail outlet of a co-operative of 40 local members. It is open for a total of 16 hours a week to sell mainly traditional crafts, though some are produced by modern methods. Crafts include spinning, weaving, canal ware, enamelling, pottery, patchwork, wood turning, pyrography, decorated eggs, leatherwork, upholstery, wrought iron, calligraphy, pewter, knitting, embroidery, soft toys, applique, quilting, macrame, children's clothes, silk-screening, textiles, pot-pourri, kitchen utensils, hand-painted china, candle-making, silversmithing, pine furniture, glass blowing and engraving, flower arrangements, water colours, pen and ink drawings, oil painting and pastels.
